p: Infections acquired during infancy are more likely to resolve on their own. Spontaneous clearance rates ranging from 20 to 45 % have been described [ 137â€“ 143]. In follow-up of perinatally acquired HCV in 266 children, approximately 20 % cleared the infection, while 80 % had chronic disease [ 144]. The disease progresses slowly and therefore advanced liver disease is uncommon in children. However, progression to advanced fibrosis and cirrhosis during childhood has been reported.
